snippet: The emerging legislation stands in sharp contrast to previous occasions when House Republicans used the leverage of a spending deadline to insist on deep spending cuts.
abstract: House and Senate leaders reach a tentative agreement on federal spending through March 2013, averting prospect of another messy shutdown debacle; emerging legislation stands in sharp contrast to previous occasions when House Republicans used the leverage of a spending deadline to insist on deep spending cuts.
lead_paragraph: The emerging legislation stands in sharp contrast to previous occasions when House Republicans used the leverage of a spending deadline to insist on deep spending cuts.

headline.seo: Congressional Leaders Reach Tentative Deal on Spending
headline.main: Leaders Reach Tentative Deal on Spending to Avoid Fight Before Election Day
headline.print_headline: Leaders Reach Tentative Deal on Spending to Avoid Fight Before Election Day
